pageContent: Purpose: Prior studies conducted primarily among white men find a reduced risk of prostate cancer associated with time since developing diabetes. While biologic explanations are plausible, the association may in part arise from more frequent prostate cancer screening among those with a diabetes diagnosis. The purpose of the present study was to investigate the association between diabetes and prostate cancer screening.

metaData.source:
Men's perspectives on the impact of prostate cancer: implications for oncology nurses
https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/11013906/
